definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
lit. to pour cold water on/fig. to dampen one's enthusiasm
shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
broad, belt-shaped noodles, popular in Shaanxi, also known as 𰻞𰻞麵|𰻝𰻝面[biang2 biang2 mian4]
spilt water/(fig.) sth that can not be retrieved/spilt milk
water once spilt cannot be retrieved (idiom); irreversible change

sentences.english: Bridget poured cold water on the idea of crossing the mountains in winter, pointing out all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 了所有的困難，對冬天越過叢山的主意潑了一瓢冷水。

sentences.english: The problem is you to this professional forums spread what on?
sentences.chinese: 問題是你來這種專業論壇上撒什麼潑？

sentences.english: It was like a cup of cold water hurled over my head.
sentences.chinese: 這像是兜頭給我潑了一瓢冷水。

sentences.english: The oaf stumbled over the bucket, spilling all the water.
sentences.chinese: 那個笨手笨腳的人絆到了木桶，把水全給潑了。

sentences.english: Poured fire Yuqing táng porridge cold, warm wind falling light shoots Yu.
sentences.chinese: 潑火雨晴餳粥冷，落花風暖筍輿輕。

sentences.english: In his opinion, continuing to pay rent each month for his apartment is just pouring money down the drain.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，繼續給付房屋租金就是將錢向水一樣往外潑。

sentences.english: Pour the sauce over the tomatoes and beans. Toss the salad well and serve.
sentences.chinese: 把醬潑在西紅柿和菜豆上，拌一拌就可以享用了。

sentences.english: He wet down the ground by buckets of water.
sentences.chinese: 他用一桶桶水把地潑溼。

sentences.english: Such increases are pouring cold water on many once-hot markets.
sentences.chinese: 這些加息給一度火熱的市場潑了一盆冷水。

sentences.english: Pendry's project is one of several around the world experimenting with invisibility .
sentences.chinese: 潑恩德利的項目是全球幾個隱形實驗項目之一。

sentences.english: Well, you bring the world the purity of music, the world has thrown you a water.
sentences.chinese: 你帶給世界那麼純淨的音樂，世界卻潑你一身髒水。

sentences.english: The hot liquid splashed down on the concrete and rebounded.
sentences.chinese: 滾燙的液體潑在水泥地面上又濺了起來。

sentences.english: Wash an ink stain out of the tablecloth.
sentences.chinese: 潑翻的墨水把桌布染成藍色。

sentences.english: The weatherman threw a wet blanket on our picnic plan when he forecast rain .
sentences.chinese: 氣象員報有雨，給我們的野餐計劃潑了冷水。

sentences.english: It was soon Uppercross with him almost every day.
sentences.chinese: 過了不久，他幾乎天天跑到厄潑克勞斯。

sentences.english: Finally, realization hit me like a cold splash of water.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我突然頓悟，如同有一瓢冷水潑向了我。

definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
